back: If it has to be added with the throws keyword and is checked at compile time.

front: What are the 3 elements in a documentation contract?
Documentation contract: What is in the preconditions?
back:
The conditions the caller of a method must fullfill.

Example: "To call getRoot(x), the caller has to provide a value x >= 0"

front: Documentation contract: What is in the postconditions?
back: The guarantees provided to the caller after executing the method, given the caller satisfied the precondition.

front: Documentation: What 2 arguments can be used in the postcondition?
back:
• old(...): refers to the previous state
  • result: return value
